description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5iqch","text":"The current protocol describes the preparation and use of 2X YT autoinduction medium for recombinant protein expression on Petri dishes. This protocol allows for reproducible and time effective expression experiments to be undertaken with minimal user intervention as compared to standard procedures using IPTG.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8obkg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1jmlm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

public_fork_note: More details on media preparation, List of required material and reagents, Video illustration on how to prepare the media (BioReach Cambridge).

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fjmfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p6iv","text":"Grow culture    of desired bacteria strain in LB broth supplemented with the appropriate antibiotic, grow overnight at   in an incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":119,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"6A714B94E1A211EBBEA60A58A9FEAC02","id":"88777","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6A714C39E1A211EBBEA60A58A9FEAC02","id":"49060","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epeqh","text":"Prepare the needed amount of 4xYT autoinduction agar medium ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6tv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n3ha","text":"(It is recommended to prepare and use Auto induction media the same day, make sure to prepare just the amount needed for the experiment) e.g 20ml of Autoinduction in 9cm Petri plates).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":183}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fr3p","text":"Composition of 4x YT autoinduction media for 1L final volume : ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vgt6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4scqk","text":"6g - Na2HPO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5joae","text":"3g - KH2PO4","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7fcv","text":"20g - Tryptone","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lcit","text":"5g - Yeast Extract","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u8d1","text":"5g - NaCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2adod","text":"15g - Agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mffh","text":"Weigh and dissolve all powders and salts (including Agar) in   of distilled water and transfer to a  Duran bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":61,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"50DD3840E61C11EBB60737ACF44317D6","id":"88778","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"55206030E61C11EBB60737ACF44317D6","id":"88779","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a844i","text":"Prepare 50% glycerol, 10% glucose and 5% lactose stock solutions to be used for reconstitution of the autoinduction media after sterilisation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffche","text":"50% (vol/vol) glycerol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sn6b","text":"- Measure 50ml of glycerol in a 250ml bottle","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7of41","text":"- Add 50 ml of distilled water and mix by shaking.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bh6n1","text":"10% (weight/volume) glucose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7gk7q","text":"- Weight 10g of glucose","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apq46","text":"- Dissolve in 100ml of water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq54t","text":"5% lactose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dokk6","text":"- Weight 10g of lactose","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dd81u","text":"- Dissolve in 200ml of water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77iku","text":" Include enough distilled water ( ) to reconstitute autoinduction medium to 1 L after sterilisation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7isoa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"2C8E4770992E11ECB240196CC18F3015","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5umdt","text":"Sterilize all solutions by autoclaving.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2eec","text":"(Also sterilise microscope slides, as well as Petri Dishes and Cell spreaders if made of glass).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4ag5","text":"After reconstituting the culture medium, add an appropriate amount of desired antibiotic  50ug/ml Kanamycin and pour   of reconstituted media in 9cm Petri dishes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ik22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32tgt","text":"(Carefully determine the number of plates needed and prepare the volume of media to prepare accordingly make sure to prepare 3 plates per culture and to include replicates for the control as well).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":197}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"B7254D40E61C11EBB60737ACF44317D6","id":"88781","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

Resuspend the cells into 1.2ml of Cold PBS and follow the original protocol for cellular reagents preparation from step6.2.9 (Protocol here).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":140,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"f9kvu","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ep39","text":"            3. Dilute resuspended cell pellet into cold PBS to obtain a suspension of A600 between 6.5 and 8 ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo83i","text":"                Measure A600 of a neat, 1:10 or 1:100 dilution. Multiply the value to get the actual final A600 number. ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":104}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdsl9","text":"                You might have to dilute several times before you get the right OD.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":54,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30ree","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e6mf","text":"            4. Calculate the volume of your final cell suspension to aliquot in each PCR tube ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g4gd","text":"                (that would contain 2 x 108 cells), using the equation:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":42,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40i71","text":"                    ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pm3j","text":"  Volume to Aliquot = 200/final A600 of cell suspension.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeek","text":"       e.g. if your final A600 is 6.5, then","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiqc7","text":"      - volume containing 2x108 cells = 200/6.5","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":30,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1itrb","text":"      - volume containing 2x108 cells = 31Âµl","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":30,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"388ld","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b4m9","text":"             5. Aliquot either single reaction or 10X reactions worth of cellular reagents into 8-tube strips ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6p8c","text":"                 of 0.2 ml PCR tubes e.g. using the example above, 3.1 Âµl (1x reaction) or 31 Âµl (10x);","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f41ue","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t0a7","text":"             6. Label tubes with reagent, date and operator","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kp34","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apko4","text":"             7. Incubate the tubes at 60C for 10min in a thermocycler or Heat block (heat treatment) ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fjua","text":"                 to make sure that produced cellular reagents are free from any living bacteria.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"oasu","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af6he","text":"             8. Place the tube strips with aliquoted cellular reagents carefully in a container 1/2 filled with desiccant, ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5js69","text":"                 leave tubes opened (using vacuum Tupperware is ideal).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aj6l5","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnlat","text":"             9. Place the container overnight in a 37 Â°C static incubator.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1qe1","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f7k6","text":"             10. After 18-24hrs check to see if the cellular reagents are completely dry.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bhi7","text":"                    Note: Leaving the reagents longer at 37 Â°C should not hurt their efficacy.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d45in","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3suhc","text":"             11. Once dry, close the lids and place them in a small bag at +4Â°C with a small amount of desiccant.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"91B84075E60F11EBB2A80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mf5weGcWcsFRUcoyyZnwkNkb2xEQZQUkSUpYNFrKX7g/edit"}}}}
